pr_title: DPC-503 fix: html validator to allow `&`

timeline.message:
DPC-503: fix html validator to allow `&`

When a name or address contained `&`, it was
failing validation due to a check to ensure that there
is no HTML in the form data. This fix ignores such `&`
characters.

timeline.author: dhgreene

replies.bodyText:
Would it make more sense to replace with " and "?

I considered this but thought it might be best to maintain the same character length. No one is actually going to see the modified string since the validator just returns a boolean, so I don't think the replacement matters much. I did go back and forth on it for a bit, though. I'm open to changing it.
replies.author: jonfulk

replies.bodyText: I think you can just change the Whitelist object to whitelist ampersand.
replies.author: MrBilnon

replies.bodyText: @whuang85 i tried that, as i mentioned in the description, but the Whitelist object seems to be made for whitelisting HTML tags and not random strings or regular expressions. I would prefer to use the whitelist object if you can help me figure out how to do that.
